channel.title: briefUpdatesMainNLbreakingNews
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbreakingNews, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: LIVE: ABC News Live
item.description: 24/7 coverage of breaking news and live events

item.title: Amazon sued over allegedly punitive workplace absence practices
item.description: A class action lawsuit filed in a New York federal court on Wednesday claims Amazon uses a "punitive absence control system" against its employees.

item.title: Trump is 'committed' to giving Americans $2,000 tariff checks: White House
item.description: President Donald Trump remains "committed" to sending each American a $2,000 dividend check to be distributed from tariff revenue.

item.title: Democrat Adelita Grijalva sworn in 7 weeks after winning House election
item.description: Democrat Adelita Grijalva was sworn in as a member of Congress on Wednesday afternoon, seven weeks after she won a special election in Arizona.

item.title: 10/8: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Former FBI Director James Comey pleads not guilty as a trial date is set for Jan. 5; New book looks at the threat of the anti-science movement.

item.title: WATCH: Concerns about AI after Matthew McConaughey creates digital version of his voice
item.description: Oscar-winning actor Matthew McConaughey has teamed up with AI company ElevenLabs to create a digital replica of his voice.

item.title: WATCH: Train operator appears to fall asleep at controls
item.description: Video appears to show a San Francisco commuter train operator falling asleep at the controls while the train traveled up to 50 mph, throwing passenger...

item.title: House debates funding bill ahead of final vote to end shutdown
item.description: The House is in session to debate a funding package that will end the longest government shutdown in U.S. history. Follow live updates here.

item.title: Appeals court weighs arguments on law cutting Medicaid funds to Planned Parenthood
Ex-aide to California governor indicted for alleged theft of campaign funds from ex-health secretary
item.description: A former top aide to California Gov. Gavin Newsom has been indicted on federal charges alleging her involvement in a scheme to steal campaign money fr...

item.title: WATCH: Chinese 'cryptoqueen' jailed for scamming billions
item.description: A Chinese woman found with $6.6 billion in Bitcoin after defrauding more than 128,000 people in China was jailed in the U.K. for over 11 years

item.title: Chicagoans buy out street vendors amid a federal immigration crackdown
SNAP benefits to resume quickly once government shutdown ends, experts say
item.description: A government funding package could soon reopen federal agencies, opening the door for food-stamp recipients to collect their full benefits.
